pregnancy 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Get or set the pregnancy.person option for pregnancy-related messages

Source: R/grammar.R
person.Rd

Functions to get and set the default person used in messages throughout the package. This affects the grammar and pronouns used in various function outputs. Settings persist for the current R session only, unless added to .Rprofile. set_person() sets the "pregnancy.person" option and get_person() retrieves it.

Usage

set_person(person)

get_person()

Arguments

person

A character string or number specifying the person. Can be:

  • "I", "1", "1st", "first", or numeric 1 for first person

  • "you", "2", "2nd", "second", or numeric 2 for second person

  • Any other name for third person

  • NULL to unset the current value

Value

Both functions invisibly return the current person setting:

  • get_person() returns the current setting (a character string) or NULL if not set

  • set_person() returns the person value that was set

See also

how_far() and other functions that use the person setting for message formatting

Examples

# Store original setting
original_person <- getOption("pregnancy.person")

# Check current setting
get_person()
#> ! You do not have `pregnancy.person` set as an option.
#> ℹ You can set it by...

# Set to first person (using string)
set_person("I")
#> ✔ person set as 'I'
#> ℹ For this R session only, functions in the pregnancy package will now use this
#>   `person` option.
#> ℹ So for now, you do not now need to supply a value to the `person` argument.
#> ℹ To make this `person` option available in all R sessions, include this code
#>   in your ".Rprofile":
#>   options(pregnancy.person = I)
#> ℹ You can edit your ".Rprofile" by calling `usethis::edit_r_profile()`
#> ℹ You can retrieve the `person` option with `get_person()`,
#>   or with `getOption('pregnancy.person')`.
get_person()
#> The person option is set as 'I'.

# Set to second person (using number)
set_person(2)
#> ✔ person set as 'You'
#> ℹ For this R session only, functions in the pregnancy package will now use this
#>   `person` option.
#> ℹ So for now, you do not now need to supply a value to the `person` argument.
#> ℹ To make this `person` option available in all R sessions, include this code
#>   in your ".Rprofile":
#>   options(pregnancy.person = You)
#> ℹ You can edit your ".Rprofile" by calling `usethis::edit_r_profile()`
#> ℹ You can retrieve the `person` option with `get_person()`,
#>   or with `getOption('pregnancy.person')`.
get_person()
#> The person option is set as 'You'.

# Set to a specific name
set_person("Sarah")
#> ✔ person set as 'Sarah'
#> ℹ For this R session only, functions in the pregnancy package will now use this
#>   `person` option.
#> ℹ So for now, you do not now need to supply a value to the `person` argument.
#> ℹ To make this `person` option available in all R sessions, include this code
#>   in your ".Rprofile":
#>   options(pregnancy.person = Sarah)
#> ℹ You can edit your ".Rprofile" by calling `usethis::edit_r_profile()`
#> ℹ You can retrieve the `person` option with `get_person()`,
#>   or with `getOption('pregnancy.person')`.
get_person()
#> The person option is set as 'Sarah'.

# Restore original setting
set_person(original_person)
#> ✔ person set as ''
#> ℹ For this R session only, functions in the pregnancy package will now use this
#>   `person` option.
#> ℹ So for now, you do not now need to supply a value to the `person` argument.
#> ℹ To make this `person` option available in all R sessions, include this code
#>   in your ".Rprofile":
#>   options(pregnancy.person = )
#> ℹ You can edit your ".Rprofile" by calling `usethis::edit_r_profile()`
#> ℹ You can retrieve the `person` option with `get_person()`,
#>   or with `getOption('pregnancy.person')`.
